page.title: 04INDUSTRY CLAPHAM SAWMILL
page.content: There is a sawmill at the top of Clapham.This morning our class went to visit it.The building is about 10 m.by 26.5 m.and is mainly limestone.It is a hundred and one years old. A water powered turbine makes the machinery work,and the electricity makes it work as well.Mr Whitfield uses a push bench and a travelling bench.They chop up trees which have fallen.The wood is used for gates and repairing fences,and fire wood.They sell the wood to the people in the village,and some people in Austwick. They cut thousands and thousands of logs a year.When they cut trees down they replant with new ones.The woods to the north of the sawmill provide most of the timber.These woods belong to Dr.J.Farrer,the Lord of the Manor.
